title: Wild Kingdom - 3 eps - Gorillas of the Mountains (Dian Fossey) [
description:
Gorillas of the Mountains 1   (1978)
A look at the life and research of Dr. Dian Fossey.

Gorillas of the Mountains 2   (1978)
The second part of a memorable profile of Dian Fossey.
   
Reunion with the Gorillas   (1984)
A follow-up profile of Fossey, who returns to Africa after several years to see if her beloved gorillas remember her. This was filmed a year before her murder.

mp3/93Kbps/32KHz/Stereo/22min

Mutual of Omaha&#039;s Wild Kingdom (1963)
Famed zoologist and naturalist Marlin Perkins hosted "Mutual of Omaha&#039;s Wild Kingdom," an educational series centering on the lives of animals. Perkins was aided by fellow naturalists Jim Fowler and Stan Brock. Shows covered a diverse range of topics from the lives of specific animals, their survival in natural and man-made environmental conditions, their relationship with other animals (both friendly and predator) and people and issues centering on animal captivity. Many of the shows were filmed in the animals&#039; natural habitat (frequently Africa and South America), though some clips originated from zoos. The show ran from 1963 to 1971 on NBC (first on Sunday afternoons and later in prime-time). Reruns were syndicated to local stations in the fall of 1971, interspersed with newly-produced shows that were produced until 1988. 

If you were a fan of Mutual of Omaha&#039;s Wild Kingdom and would like to see some famous scenes like that of Perkins wrestling a python, check out 
www.wildkingdom.com/nostalgia/video.html

Leave a comment if you&#039;d like to see more from the original Mutual of Omaha&#039;s Wild Kingdom. :)
